favourite.article: Stanza #2 But that's not all Christ lives in me I once was blind but now I see It pleased the Father to reveal the Son in Me That I become the same as He Christ now is being formed in me Till all my death is swallowed up in victory.

William C. Kieffer, Here is your portuguese translation. It isn't that hard. I just copied the song and went to Google Translate. On the left side I pasted the version I wanted translated, on the right side I clicked on Portuguese and this is what I came up with. Good luck and may God be with you. R. Grosinsky. 1 Eu tinha uma dívida que eu não podia pagar, Ele pagou a dívida que Ele não devia, Eu precisava de alguém, Para lavar meus pecados. E agora eu cantar uma canção nova marca, "Amazing grace" durante todo o dia, Jesus Cristo pagou a dívida, Que eu nunca poderia pagar.
Does anyone know of a Portuguese translation of this hymn? We have been missionaries in Brazil for over 35 years. It would be so nice to discover a translation.
I do sing a brand new song because Christ Jesus washed all my sins away. A debt I owed and could not pay (sin).

I was only a week saved in 1976 and went to my first church service in a wee pentecostal church they sang this song "I had a debt..." it touched me so much that I wept my way through the service people came and laid hands on me to pray with me. Each time I think of this wee chorus I always think of that first service I went to and realise how much the Lord loves me. Thank You Jesus.

I have a debt, I can never never pay, I don't even know You Lord, what causes You to pay for my sins, what causes You to pay the debt? Lord I kept turning away from You... Wow Lord truly You are full of grace and tender mercy! Lord I Love You.
Many thanks to pastor Chris who taught me song during Higher Life Conference.
Christ paid my debt and I am free. Amen.
Beautiful song but still wondering why there are no more stanzas or does anyone know a second stanza to this hymn?
I love the music to this song, and would love to know if it's a song that I can record on my own CD and credited to the site. How would that work?
What a wonderful verse and tune. We'll learn it in our Sunday School!
This is a lovely tune, I will teach my kids and choir members at my church. God bless you. My soul is revived and been reminded of Jesus' mercy for me.
All the children loved this song and enjoyed the second verse.
This is a sweet song and heart-touching song! May we have the reality behind this song and know the person of Jesus!

New stanza:
So now my debt is fully paid And I have peace—night and day I am not guilty—my sins are washed away Now I can sing that brand new song Amazing grace, all day long Christ Jesus paid the debt That I could never pay.
Aaron, Hannah, Nathan, David, and I sang this song together while watching the webcast of the 2009 Winter Training in Eureka! What a supply and a joy!
This is a GREAT song! I recommend it.
I learned this song in meeting time! Amen!
